body_html:
I think the issue is that the old node names (before the obsfucation) are still being used for colocation attributes. Since collocation not usually needed on mobile devices, you could try also running a graph transform to get rid of the attribute that defines it. Something like

--transforms='remove_attribute(attribute_name=_class)'

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/tools/graph_transforms/#remove_attribute

Let me know if that workaround helps. The real fix is to update the node names in the attribute to the obsfucated versions, but that would be fairly involved.

body:
I think the issue is that the old node names (before the obsfucation) are still being used for colocation attributes. Since collocation not usually needed on mobile devices, you could try also running a graph transform to get rid of the attribute that defines it. Something like

--transforms='remove_attribute(attribute_name=_class)'

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/tools/graph_transforms/#remove_attribute

Let me know if that workaround helps. The real fix is to update the node names in the attribute to the obsfucated versions, but that would be fairly involved.
